summary: An FBI internal email from April 8, 2021, requesting agent assistance to monitor Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team during a three-day evidence review at the courthouse from April 13-15, 2021. The document outlines logistical details for security, monitoring, and room assignments.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the case, to be produced by the Marshals and monitored by FBI agents during a multi-day evidence review with her defense team.

events.title: Start of Evidence Review for Maxwell Case
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team begin reviewing evidence in the proffer room area on the 5th floor of the courthouse, with FBI agents monitoring and an AUSA present.

events.title: Scheduled Three-Day Evidence Review
events.description: A scheduled three-day period (April 13-15, 2021) for Maxwell's defense team to review evidence, requiring FBI agent assistance for security and monitoring.

keyFacts: FBI Squad C-20 requested 2-3 agents to assist with monitoring Ghislaine Maxwell during a three-day evidence review from April 13-15, 2021.
Maxwell was to be produced by the Marshals each morning by approximately 9:30 AM and required an FBI agent with a handcuff key to escort and monitor her throughout the day, including bathroom breaks.
Three proffer rooms were reserved: one for evidence review, one for private defense team meetings, and one as a break area for agents and AUSAs.
